intro: Stachys erecta, commonly known as upright hedge nettle, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring upright, branching stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, pinkish-white flowers in whorled clusters, which bloom from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Stachys erecta is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
